meanings.definition: In a meretricious manner; falsely attractive or alluring
meanings.sent1: She smiled meretriciously at the stranger, hoping to get his attention.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement for the product was designed to meretriciously lure customers in.
meanings.sent3: The magician meretriciously waved his wand, trying to impress the audience.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises were as meretriciously appealing as they were empty.
meanings.sent5: The shiny packaging meretriciously hid the poor quality of the contents.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of a prostitute; vulgar or tawdry
meanings.sent1: The meretriciously dressed woman caught everyone's eye at the party.
meanings.sent2: The hotel room was decorated in a meretriciously flashy style.
meanings.sent3: The meretriciously decorated cake looked more like a work of art than a dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her meretriciously bright personality made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The meretriciously designed costume left little to the imagination.
